summary:
Dysentery is a stomach illness that causes bloody diarrhea, fever, and stomach pain. It can be caused by bacteria like Shigella or an amoeba called Entamoeba histolytica. Poor sanitation and contaminated food or water can spread it.

To prevent dysentery, wash your hands and be careful with food when traveling in places with poor sanitation. Most cases get better on their own, but staying hydrated is crucial. Antibiotics might be used for severe cases. Dysentery is common in developing countries and has been known for centuries.
title: Dysentery
